intro: Pinguicula megaspilaea, commonly known as the Mexican butterwort, is a carnivorous plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, sticky leaves that trap and digest small insects. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires consistent humidity to flourish. Its botanical features make it a unique and intriguing subject for both scientific study and botanical gardens.
